text: the general assembly will hear an
address
by his Excellency
Rashad Muhammad al-alimi
president of the presidential Leadership
Council of the Republic of Yemen
I request protocol to escort his
Excellency
on behalf of the general assembly I have
the honor to welcome his Excellency
president of the presidential Leadership
Council of the Republic of Yemen and to
invite him to address the assembly
in the name of God be merciful the
compassionate your Excellency Mr Dennis
Francis the president of the general
assembly your Excellency Mr Antonio
Gutierrez the Secretary General of the
United Nations your majesties Royal
highnesses excellencies ladies and
gentlemen this new session of the United
Nations is held as we Face new and
complicated environmental political and
economic challenges therefore we all
need new Solutions and we need to change
our traditional manner to address these
challenges we also need to put an end to
the suffering of the yemeni people the
slogan of this session truly meets the
aspirations of
our yemeni people
so that we can rebuild trust in our
institutions and reignite
solidarity in order to support
sustainable developments towards peace
prosperity and progress for all the
members of the presidential Leadership
Council would like to commend the
unified position of the International
Community that supports the
Constitutional legitimacy the
sovereignty Independence and territorial
Integrity of Yemen and the
non-interference and its International
Affairs we also commend this unified
political position of the International
Community towards Yemen
we also thank our brethren in the
Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the United
Arab Emirates for their solidarity with
our people their positions were
represented as strong fence to prevent
the collapse of the institutions of the
yemeni state they also supported our
resistance in the face of houthi
militias supported by the Iranian regime
Mr President
we had to rebuild our institutions we
had to re-establish a presidential
Leadership Council based on partnership
building peace and ending the war
however despite this important
transformation and despite
the regional and international momentum
to achieve peace however
peace remained elusive despite the
compromises from the yemeni government
we thank our brethren in the Kingdom of
Saudi Arabia and the sultanate of Oman
for their efforts and we thank
the envoy
for their efforts
we do hope that the militias will
recognize the truth that only a state
that is based on the rule of law
and equal citizenship will help us to
make sure that our country is stable and
safe this these are the demands of the
legitimate
government
we need
we know that we need partnership in
order to build our country in order to
reach a bright future
today I don't believe that we have
enough time or we have enough
compromises
to make in order to convince the houthi
militias to change their positions we
can even predict their intentions for
decades to come if we do that this
approach will lead the yemeni people
back to the ages of ignorance and
oppression our country can even become a
hot spot to export terrorism and to
launch a regional and international
conflict that cannot be contained
through diplomatic means therefore any
complacency from the International
Community
or if we
deal with the militias as a de facto
Authority this means that oppression the
violations of freedoms this Behavior
will not be we will not be able to
eradicate this Behavior easily
we know that the housing militias only
use peace agreements as a way in order
to delay further and acquire further
resources
this is why they chirked previous
agreements the latest of which the
Stockholm agreement therefore we
reaffirm the need to have the right
guarantees for peace it should be based
on the three terms of references that
were agreed upon at the national
Regional and international levels we
need to respect International legitimacy
pursuant to the Saudi initiative
furthermore a sustainable peace should
be based on Justice fairness
and addressing pending key National
issues any peace agreement or any
measures to build trust they should be
able to achieve tangible results in
order to alleviate the suffering of the
yamani people so that
we can make sure that those who benefit
are the victims of the conflict notably
women and children
sustaining peace
and ending the war this is the only way
to guarantee that the yemeni people will
be able to build their state
institutions that guarantee and protect
their rights and freedoms and equality
among citizenship citizens
and also build good neighborly relations
with our brethren in the GCC countries
today I believe there is a path a sure
path towards peace
by rekindling the trust of the yemeni
people in international legitimacy and
in their national government
for that to happen we need to support
the legal government we need to
strengthen the economy so that the
government can provide services
so that we can put an end to the
militias so that we can build a brighter
future promoted by you and envoys
everywhere I also believe that our
International System must protect
International peace and stability it
should support the will of the people
and their National governments this
could be achieved today easily with the
easiest of access to information with
determining facts
however we need to prioritize the will
of the people so that we can strengthen
their trust in this institution and the
International Community we are not
trying to check our responsibilities or
to blame the International Community for
our failures no we need to believe that
superpowers should send a strong message
to militias
not only in Yemen but all over the world
that they should not overturn
constitutional legitimacies so that we
can end any wishes armed groups could
have to establish entities that compete
with legitimate governments Mr President
Secretary General ladies and gentlemen
to restore trust and Achieve progress in
the yamani dossier we must recognize
that a track based on International
humanitarian intervention should be
reconsidered
and should be addressed so that it is in
line with international law and efforts
to combat terrorism rebellion and armed
groups we welcome the efforts of the
United Nations to move from relief
interventions in my country towards
sustainable development this
transformation should also include
Financial pledges through the yemeni
central bank they recognized yemeni
Central Bank in order to strengthen our
national currency
and to make sure that these funds do not
fall in the hands of armed militias
this track contradicts with the
international rhetoric which calls for
an improvement in the yemeni economic
indicators at a time when their
International operations are going
through institutions under the control
of 40 militias
although healthy militias continue with
their arbitrary measures to violate the
independence of the banking sector the
confidentiality of its operations and to
turn this sector into a network for
laundering money
moving forward with this approach means
that the institutions of Yemen this
member state in the United Nations will
remain weak will Renee will remain
underfunded and will not have the
necessary resources to deal with these
cross-border challenges furthermore
these policies could further feed the
war economy will allow for the flow of
funds through
banking channels that are not
accountable
the humanitarian intervention of the
yemeni government proves that this this
support improves basic services to save
the lives of millions of men women and
children to strengthen the prospects for
peace we choose to promote development
and prosperity and not violence death
and hatred as healthy militias do
from this very Rostrum last year I have
said that
every Delay from the International
Community to be more firm when it comes
to the yamani dossier the losses will be
greater and militias healthy militias
will continue with their cross-border
threats they will continue to commit
great violations of human rights the
same human rights that this institution
has been promoting for the last 70 years
this year we have witnessed an increase
in the threats of al-Qaeda and Isis
supported by houthi militias and by the
Iranian regime with money weapons
and intelligence support they also share
the same takfiri ideology as I have said
a year ago from this very Rostrum
the public budget of our state
showed great indicators since the start
of the war we were able to improve
Services create job opportunities
however this momentum stopped as a
result of healthy terrorist attacks
against oil facilities
I take this opportunity to say were it
not for the generous donation from our
Brethren and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
a grant of 1.2 billion dollars to
support our public budget we would have
been unable to honor our obligations
including the disbursement of salaries
we also
commend in this regard the humanitarian
and development pledges from our
brethren in the United Arab Emirates our
friends in the United States the EU the
UK and other Regional and international
partners
despite these humanitarian interventions
allow me to say that houthi militias
escalated recently their threats they
targeted navigation routes in the Red
Sea in the bab al-mandab Strait and the
Aiden and the Gulf of Aden they've used
these as military areas they've tested
new weapons they've targeted commercial
ships and tankers that means that these
militias supported by the Iranian regime
continue to destabilize the region to
undermine efforts in order to renew the
truth and resume the political process
and today they flaunt the military
capabilities
on the 21st of September which is the
day when they overturned the legitimate
government
today we reaffirmed the need to
guarantee the freedom of international
navigation to combat extremism terrorism
piracy and support measures to prevent
the proliferation of nuclear weapons and
other weapons of mass destruction
notably the nuclear the Iranian nuclear
weapon their ballistic missiles and
their role in sabotaging the region we
call on the International Community to
condemn this blatant Iranian
interventions and the Affairs of my
country
and to submit it to sanctions pursuant
to resolutions of international
legitimacy in this regard we call on
member states to commit to the arms
embargo and to prevent Iran from
providing its militias with military
capabilities such as ballistic missiles
and drones used to launch terrorist
attacks against
innocent civilians
the presidential Leadership Council
and the government remain committed to
all International agreements and
conventions including the protection of
children and to make sure that they do
not participate in the armed conflict we
also provide a necessary guarantees for
the work of international
organizations and make sure to
facilitate the delivery of assistance to
all those in need
we have also established an independent
National Committee to investigate an
allegations of violations of human
rights
all agreements
signed by the U.N with Hoshi militia
militias have not been implemented yet
the healthy militias continues to
recruit children and to send them to
battlefields
in full view of the International
Community
healthy militias violate human rights
daily
they impose restriction on travel work
and education of women they oppress
and kidnap
journalists
we would like
to reaffirm our position our firm
position regarding the Palestinian issue
we will continue to support the path
towards peace towards a comprehensive
and just solution for this Palestinian
issue on the basis of resolutions of
international legitimacy and the Arab
peace initiative in a way that would
guarantee that the Palestinian people
will be able to establish their
independent state we also support peace
in the Sudan and we support the efforts
of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Egypt and
the US in this regard so that this
country can once again enjoy security
and stability we also express our
condolences to Libya and the kingdom of
Morocco
for for the victims of the tornadoes and
earthquakes and we thank the countries
that supported both countries especially
Egypt as we witness an increase in the
risk of climate change I thank you May
the peace mercy and blessings of God be
upon you
[Applause]
on behalf of the general assembly I wish
to thank the president of the
presidential Leadership Council of the
Republic of Yemen for the statement just
made and a request protocol to escort
his Excellency
